timeline.message:
Add rate aggregation

Adds a new rate aggregation that can calculate a document rate for buckets
of a date_histogram.

Closes #60674

timeline.bodyText: Nit: Since we're touching this anyway, we could move to the new formatting standard (which would put each param on a new line here)
timeline.author: not-napoleon

timeline.bodyText: Nit: I think the technical term is divisor not divider.
timeline.author: not-napoleon

timeline.bodyText: Note to self: LeafOnly shouldn't be generic over ValuesSource.  How did I miss that when I was removing generics? I'll clean that up in a separate PR.
timeline.author: not-napoleon

timeline.bodyText: Nit: Formatting.  This is a new file, should just run the formatter on the whole thing.
timeline.author: not-napoleon

timeline.bodyText: We shouldn't be using this work-around in new aggregators.  Instead of using a null here, RateAggregatorFactory#createUnmapped should return an aggregator that uses a NO_OP_COLLECTOR, and we should rely on valuesSource being not null in this aggregator.
timeline.author: not-napoleon

timeline.bodyText: Is there a use case for running Rate over a Date field?  I'm having a hard time imagining one. If there is a use case for it, let's leave a comment so we remember why we want it, and if not let's not support passing in Date fields.  It's much easier to add support later if we find a use case than it is to remove support for a supported data type, even if it only generates nonsense results.
timeline.author: not-napoleon
